Event.name: Cause_to_make_noise
Event.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> manipulates a <fen>Sound_maker</fen> or a <fen>Cause</fen> causes the <fen>Sound_maker</fen> to emit a sound. <ex><fex name="Agent">The monks</fex> would <t>ring</t> <fex name="Sound_maker">the bell</fex> until sundown.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The individual that manipulates a Sound_maker so that it makes Noise.
<ex><fex name="Agent">You</fex> can <t>ring</t> the bell as often as you'd like. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Sound_maker
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity that produces the Noise, as a result of the action of the Agent.</def-root>

Arg.name: Subregion
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Subregion</fen> is the sublocation of the <fen>Sound_maker</fen> from which the sound is emitting.</def-root>

Arg.name: Location_of_protagonist
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location from which an <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> acts to project sound from a <fen>Sound_maker</fen> toward an (implicit) perceiver.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of one of the primary participants (either <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Sound_maker</fen>) during the course of the sound-making event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (<ment>probably, presumably, mysteriously</ment>), force (<ment>hard, softly</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An action directly due to the <fen>Agent</fen> or Cause that results in the <fen>Sound_maker</fen> emitting noise.. </def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>The inanimate force of nature that causes the <fen>Sound_maker</fen> to produce noise.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The state-of-affairs or action that the <fen>Agent</fen> wishes to bring about by performing the action.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time at which the noise is produced.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location at which the sound is produced.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>The number of times the <fen>Sound_maker</fen> makes noise per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often.</def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>Used for expressions that indicate the number of times <fen>Sound_maker</fen> makes noise. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: blare.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to make a loud harsh sound

lexUnit.name: blast.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: produce loud continuous music or noise.

lexUnit.name: clang.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to make a resonant metallic sound

lexUnit.name: creak.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to make a harsh high-pitched sound when moving or applying pressure

lexUnit.name: peep.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause something to emit a short, high-pitched squeaking sound

lexUnit.name: tinkle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to make a light, clear ringing sound.

lexUnit.name: play.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: manipulate (a device, generally an instrument or storage medium) so as to produce musical sounds.

lexUnit.name: ringer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who rings something.

lexUnit.name: ring.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to make a clear resonant or vibrating sound

lexUnit.name: honk.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to emit a honk.

lexUnit.name: toot.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to make a toot.

lexUnit.name: beep.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause something to emit a short, high-pitched sound

lexUnit.name: clash.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to strike objects together, causing a loud noise

lexUnit.name: sound.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause something to make a noise

lexUnit.name: toll.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to ring a bell repeatedly

lexUnit.name: trumpet.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause something to make a loud sound, as of a trumpet
